title: Add `sk template create` CLI
description: Implement a first-class 'sk template create <name> "<description>"' subcommand that copies a configurable template skill into 'skills/<name>', rewrites SKILL.md metadata, and drops stub prompt/test files. Generated SKILL.md matches the CLI-provided name/description and stub prompt/test files exist. Automated tests cover the default flow plus a config override.

title: Rename MCP tool names to underscores
Badge: keep `sk repo list` working offline
description: The new repo list output counts skills per repo by calling `load_skills_for_spec`, which always runs `git fetch --prune`. If any cached repo is unreachable or requires credentials, that fetch fails and the entire `sk repo list` command errors out before printing anything, even though the data is already available locally. Previously the command worked offline because it only read the local registry. Update the implementation so unreachable repos are skipped (or marked dirty) and their last-known counts from the cache are used. Emit a dirty flag next to stale numbers instead of failing the command.

title: Address qlty smell high-complexity and duplication warnings
description:
`qlty smells --all --no-upgrade-check` now runs in CI and reports advisory findings for several files:
- High total complexity in src/doctor.rs, src/main.rs, src/precommit.rs, src/sync.rs, and src/upgrade.rs.
- Large duplicated integration-test scaffolding across tests/check_modified.rs, tests/install_ambiguous.rs, tests/install_file_url.rs, tests/precommit.rs, tests/remove.rs, tests/status.rs, tests/support/mod.rs, tests/update_cache_only.rs, tests/upgrade_atomicity.rs, tests/upgrade_fetch.rs, tests/upgrade_symlink.rs, and tests/upgrade_symlink_windows.rs.

We should evaluate these hot spots, split helpers out of `run_doctor`/`run_sync_back`, and deduplicate the repeated end-to-end test harness to keep the new qlty smells job clean.

title: Force git archive to bypass autocrlf in extract paths
description: The new digest refresh flow broke Windows CI because `git archive` was honoring the runner’s `core.autocrlf=true` setting, so reinstalling after auto-merge wrote CRLF while the merged commit remained LF. As a result `sync_back_refreshes_local_digest_to_merged_commit` failed (`remote v2\n` vs `remote v2\r\n`) and the lock digest could diverge per OS. We need to run every `git archive` we invoke (install, doctor rebuilds, upgrade staging, template create) with `core.autocrlf=false` so extracted files always match the committed bytes regardless of host defaults.

title: Ensure sk sync-back refreshes skills.lock after upstream merge
description:
Repro (reported by user):
1. Run 'sk install @lambdamechanic/skills dumbwaiter-mcp'.
2. Make local edits, then run 'sk sync-back dumbwaiter-mcp --repo @lambdamechanic/skills --skill-path dumbwaiter-mcp'.
3. Wait for the PR to merge upstream.

Even though local files match the merged commit, skills.lock.json still points at the pre-PR commit. 'sk doctor' warns 'Upgrade available (old -> new)' and 'sk status --json' shows the same, because the lock entry never updated.

Expectation: a successful sync-back (plus auto-merge) should bump the lock to the merged commit so the local install is considered up-to-date.

Task: teach 'sk sync-back' to refresh skills.lock.json to the merged commit whenever the push/PR succeeds (or when --repo/branch overrides are used) so users don't immediately get upgrade warnings.

title: Refresh local install digest when auto-merge rewrites commit
description: PR #22 adds logic to bump the lock entry to the GitHub merge commit when sync-back auto-merge succeeds, but we still leave the local skill directory (and its digest) at the pre-merge tree. If upstream main advanced after we started editing, the merge commit can contain extra changes that never make it back into the local install, so `skills.lock.json` ends up with the merge commit SHA but the digest of the old tree. Need to rehydrate the install directory from the merged commit and recompute the digest so local files match what landed.
